meanings.definition: Soldiers trained to fight on foot or on horseback
meanings.sent1: The dragoons rode swiftly on their horses to reach the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The dragoons marched in formation, ready for battle.
meanings.sent3: The dragoons tried to play soccer on horseback, but it was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: The dragoons' unity in battle was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dragoons charging into battle stayed etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: To coerce or oppress by harsh or oppressive means
meanings.sent1: The king dragoons his subjects into submission with fear.
meanings.sent2: The dictator dragoons the citizens into following his orders.
meanings.sent3: The teacher dragoons the students into completing their homework on time.
meanings.sent4: The storm dragoons the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The bully dragoons the smaller kids on the playground, making them do his bidding.
